p: Another combination of protease inhibitors was previously reported to be bioequivalent to the lopinavir/ritonavir combination in healthy volunteers, with the advantage of avoiding the adverse effects of ritonavir [ 28]. Cobicistat is an analog of ritonavir and a potent CYP3A inhibitor. It has no antiviral activity. Like ritonavir, it inhibits CYP2D6 and p-glycoprotein. Cobicistat also inhibits drug transporters, e.g., organic anion transport protein (OATP1B1) which is the main transporter for statins [ 29]. Clinical trials were registered to compare the combination of darunavir and cobicistat for conventional treatment in patients with COVID-19 (NCT04252274 and ChiCTR2000029541).
